conbody.p:
A fundamental principle of DITA is information typing, which categorises information according to the nature of the content. The three base DITA information types are
Concept
Task
Reference
The aim of all sorts of written communication is to transmit a message. The purpose, the audience and the delivery method determine the best approach.

DITA categorises key business information by communication purpose, or information type. There are three base DITA information types:
Concept
Task
Reference
The concept, task, and reference base types are sometimes called core information types , as they are considered to be universally relevant.
